panels.description: Resource pressure via PSI
panels.title: Pressure

panels.description: Overall CPU busy percentage (averaged across all cores)
panels.title: CPU Busy

panels.description: System load  over all CPU cores together
panels.title: Sys Load

panels.description: Real RAM usage excluding cache and reclaimable memory
panels.title: RAM Used

panels.description: Percentage of swap space currently used by the system
panels.title: SWAP Used

panels.description: Used Root FS
panels.title: Root FS Used

panels.description: Latency percentiles (50th, 90th, 99th)
panels.title: HTTP Latency Percentiles

panels.description: Requests per second (RPS)
panels.title: HTTP RPS (Current)

panels.description: CPU time spent busy vs idle, split by activity type
panels.title: CPU Basic

panels.description: RAM and swap usage overview, including caches
panels.title: Memory Basic

panels.description: Per-interface network traffic (receive and transmit) in bits per second
panels.title: Network Traffic Basic

panels.description: Percentage of filesystem space used for each mounted device

targets.expr: ((node_filesystem_size_bytes{instance="$node", job="$job", device!~"rootfs"} - node_filesystem_avail_bytes{instance="$node", job="$job", device!~"rootfs"}) / node_filesystem_size_bytes{instance="$node", job="$job", device!~"rootfs"}) * 100

panels.title: Disk Space Used Basic

panels.description: CPU time usage split by state, normalized across all CPU cores

matcher.options: Idle - Waiting for something to happen
Iowait - Waiting for I/O to complete
Nice - Niced processes executing in user mode
Steal - Time spent in other operating systems when running in a virtualized environment
System - Processes executing in kernel mode
User - Normal processes executing in user mode

targets.legendFormat: System - Processes executing in kernel mode
User - Normal processes executing in user mode
Nice - Niced processes executing in user mode
Iowait - Waiting for I/O to complete
Steal - Time spent in other operating systems when running in a virtualized environment
Idle - Waiting for something to happen

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_guest_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[$__rate_interval]))) > 0

panels.title: CPU

panels.description: Breakdown of physical memory and swap usage. Hardware-detected memory errors are also displayed

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

targets.legendFormat: Apps - Memory used by user-space applications
PageTables - Memory used to map between virtual and physical memory addresses
SwapCache - Memory that keeps track of pages that have been fetched from swap but not yet been modified
Slab - Memory used by the kernel to cache data structures for its own use (caches like inode, dentry, etc)
Cache - Parked file data (file content) cache
Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

panels.title: Memory

panels.description: Incoming and outgoing network traffic per interface
panels.title: Network Traffic

panels.description: Network interface utilization as a percentage of its maximum capacity
panels.title: Network Saturation

panels.description: Disk I/O operations per second for each device
panels.title: Disk IOps

panels.description: Disk I/O throughput per device
panels.title: Disk Throughput

panels.description: Amount of available disk space per mounted filesystem, excluding rootfs. Based on block availability to non-root users
panels.title: Filesystem Space Available

panels.description: Disk usage (used = total - available) per mountpoint
panels.title: Filesystem Used

panels.description: Percentage of time the disk was actively processing I/O operations
panels.title: Disk I/O Utilization

panels.description:
How often tasks experience CPU, memory, or I/O delays. Some indicates partial slowdown; Full indicates all tasks are stalled. Based on Linux PSI metrics:
https://docs.kernel.org/accounting/psi.html
panels.title: Pressure Stall Information
